text:
Hi guys I have a question about properties count limitation. I read that a free account can only have 10 properties, yet this limit does not seem to be applied to the properties api. I say this because I just created more than 10 new properties for a free account.

Can anyone confirm if there is any limitation on creating properties via api (lets say contact properties)?

Hello all,
I am trying to fetch companies list via API. But the API documentation only shows contacts list. Is there any other API for companies list?
Thank you for pointing this out, I will circle up with the team to get this fixed.

Anyone hit issues with the workflow enrollment returning a 404 in test portals?  I have verified the email exist for the portal and the workflow ID, but when I make the API call, it returns a 404 regardless.

Hi there, We’re facing the following issue with our HubSpot Connected App.

The connected app we’ve built isn’t listed on App Marketplace yet and even if we list it there, the installation will be from our application (3rd party website) and not from the App Marketplace.

We use oauth to authenticate the app and scope (permissions) only includes contacts and crm.import. Here’s our Install URL (client id + re-direct-uri are hidden for security purposes).

`<https://app-xyz.HubSpot.com/oauth/authorize?client_id=><client-id>&redirect_uri=<re-direct-uri>&scope=contacts%20oauth%20crm.import`

The ideal flow of events are as follows:
1. HubSpot Super admin creates a user who has just access to contacts and import permissions
2. Shares the login credentials with subscribers of our platform who are working with the client (who owns HubSpot) to connect the app to import leads into their HubSpot 
The problem we’re running into is that, only Super-admin users are able to connect/install the app from our application. For the lower-grade users (our ideal set of users), we’re getting this error “_*Couldn’t complete the connection.* You don’t have permission to connect this app_.”

We need the API-Only users or something similar to tackle this, I believe. Does HubSpot allow non-Super admins to install apps into their HubSpot instance at all? Any input is appreciated.
Hey <@U01QVR44MEY> this should be fixed up now.
If I understand correctly, Something like ring central Labs and Hello Sign, allow for the master application to be installed, then each user have to authenticate again
Ring Central, each user needs to authenticate there phone. To be able to use meeting links
When the app is installed on HubSpot, the confirmation page will provide a user level oauth link

Hey all, I need to make a single-page multi-step form. The community forums say that HubSpot lacks such functionality out of the box and that the workaround is to make multiple pages and multiple forms.  I want to know if the Forms API can be leveraged to accomplish the following use case:  The form would be embedded on a single page, asking the user 4 questions on Step 1, user clicks a button to continue, and then answers 3 more questions on Step 2. Step 2 would have a button to submit the data collected.

<@U0193SFJ36H> You could use Jquery, hide the other forms until they click the next button.   Or create the form as one large form and use jquery to hide and show questions based on what you are up to.
<@U034F15CX8U>  I like your second suggestion and will give that one a try. Thanks!
I think you will have to set that to make the JS work

<@U01AWLPS4SJ> created <https://github.com/thesnappingdog/HubSpot-multistep-form-generator|this repo> for a multistep form on HubSpot.  been a minute since last update.  I imagine it is still good, though
